MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: A short time after the battle ended, the windows of the buildings in the town were lit one after another. It seemed that the evacuated citizens had returned.
Tonight, we will stay at an inn and wait for the sun to rise before joining the knights of St. Iris to clean up the mist monsters that are roaming outside the city.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Conductor, do you have a moment?
Oculus came into the room I had been assigned as my office. What's wrong? Get some rest until the mission starts tomorrow. Or have you come for a lecture?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Ah, I forgot about that.
How about we let sleeping dogs lie?

It's a joke. I'm not going to lecture you.
Anyway, what is it?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Err, someone from the town came to see me. There's a sanatorium a bit far from the town and they haven't received any medicine or food for three days now.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I heard it's not that far away,
so I was wondering if we could quickly organize a team to carry medicine and food.

Hmm, I understand.
I'll organize a supply team tomorrow morning.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Tomorrow morning is too late! There might be children who are hungry or suffering because they can't get their medicine.

We've just finished our mission, so everyone is exhausted.
You know that better than anyone.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I know, but...

We don't have the strength to spare.
I can't send out my troops without letting them have a break first.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Yeah... I understand.
I'll go tell the man from the town.
With that, Oculus walked out of the room. I wanted to do something about it, but as the man responsible for the unit, I had no choice.
Now...

I left the inn and headed for the entrance of the town,
and sure enough, there was Oculus with a large bag on her back.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I guess this'll do?
Or maybe I can hold a bit more.

What are you doing out here so late at night?
I told you to rest.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Conductor!? No, no, I wasn't going to the sanatorium on my own to bring them supplies!

Thank you for the clear explanation.
You've practically admitted to it.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Oh, seriously?
Am I really that big of a screw-up?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I thought if I was back by morning, you wouldn't notice.

I thought you'd think as much.
Well, I guess that means we were both thinking the same thing.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Huh? You don't mean...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
You were also planning to deliver
medicine to the sanatorium?
Well, yeah. I can't send the troops out officially, but it shouldn't be a problem for the two of us to go as individuals.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Are you sure it won't be a problem?
Not so long as we're back by the morning, right?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hah!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Thank you! I love you so much! I just knew you'd come through!

You say that, but it looks like you were ready to go on your own regardless. But oh well. We can carry twice as much luggage now it's the two of us.
Let's hurry and be on our way.

I walked along the road with Oculus toward the sanatorium,
illuminated by the moon.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: So, the town I grew up in, there was nothing there and everyone thought that was perfectly normal. It was like time stood still in that place.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Then, one day, my friend got sick. Everyone said that there was no medicine in town to cure the disease and that they had to wait for the medicine peddler to come.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I thought that was strange.
If we don't have it, why don't we just go get it?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: That was my first trip.

Sounds a lot like what we're doing now.
So that's why you were so dedicated to delivering these supplies.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: That's right. It was during that trip that I saw the mist. I was really lucky that I didn't get caught in the mist and made it back with the medicine.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Then I thought about it. The reason we can't get things or go where we want is because of the mist, right? If only there was no mist, the world would be peaceful.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
But the more I look into it, the more I don't know what the mist is
or how to get rid of it.
But you still won't give up, right?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I've never thought about giving up. And now I've become a train knight
and I've met you.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: This isn't a miracle or fate. There must be something we can do. So long as we don't give up, anything is possible.
That's right. At least that's why the SSS was formed. I believe that so long as we don't give up, we'll be able to erase the mist from this world one day.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Right? That's why I became a train knight.
I know I'm on the right track.

As we talked, we turned onto a narrow branch road leading to the sanatorium. It wasn't long before a light mist began to drift around us.
It wasn't just any mist, but the phantom mist.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
There are monsties here.
I can feel it in my bones.
By monsties, you mean mist monsters?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's too long to say mist monster every time.
Plus, I figured it'd be better to just call them something cute.
Right, I see... If we keep going, we'll probably end up having to fight them. What should we do?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Is there another way around?
Checking the map, we found a way to avoid the phantom mist and get to the sanatorium, although it would take longer than continuing on and plowing through the mist.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Oculus
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Alright, let's go.
It might be unusual for Oculus, but our goal right now is not to fight the mist monsters. It is to deliver supplies to the sanatorium.
In order to achieve our goal, we decided to take a different path.
